_header: Now to speak will I not spare
_description: On Speaking for one’s self — one eight-line stanza, cross-rhymed

Lincoln105.First Lines:
Now to speke will I noght spareSen speche has made me forto
                    spede…
Lincoln105.Last Lines:
…ne lenger lyfe with owten kareþan till euer ilke worde
                    take hede
Lincoln105.Editions:
Woolley,  Reginald Maxwell. 
             Catalogue of the Manuscripts of Lincoln Cathedral Chapter
                Library.
         London: Milford, 1927: 68.

YaleBei163.Transcription:
Ther schalbe never man wyn in his chaffereThat ever wulle by and
                    nowght wulle bedeNe no man lyve wyth out careWho so wulle of euery
                    word take hede
YaleBei163.Note:
Last four lines only; immediately follows 4490 and 5330 as if a third stanza; headed
                    ‘Disce’.
YaleBei163.Editions:
Brown,  Carleton Fairchild. 
             A Register of Middle English Religious & Didactic Verse.
         2 vols. London: Oxford University Press for the Bibliographical
            Society: 1916-20: 1.477.
Lass,  Roger. 
             “Three Middle English Cautionary Lyrics from a Yale University
                Ms.” 
             Anglia
         83 (1965): 172-5: 173.
